results.content:
The course is outdated .

XMLVIews are not used.The examples used are too basic and repetitive.No clear explanation is given on concepts like manifest json file , Controller logic , components model , WEBIDE - without which it not UI5. Sorry to say but ,This course creates more confusion than help on UI5 real projects.

OPENSAP course - Developing Web Apps with SAPUI5 is best alternative for real UI5 feel.

https://open.sap.com/courses/ui51/items/1KrtQsfID3czTalvNs2Tls
results.content_html:
The course is outdated .

OPENSAP course - Developing Web Apps with SAPUI5 is best alternative for real UI5 feel.

https://open.sap.com/courses/ui51/items/1KrtQsfID3czTalvNs2Tls

results.content: Section 6 where the main piece should be is very rough. This should be concentrating on the final project and showing examples of MVC the whole way on the same MVC files. Very confusing with moving bits of code between the view and controller without any touch on logic with model data in a separate file. After several lessons dealing with the dummy data, this should include how to import from a database. Suggest redoing this course for a simple register user, login user, and have user do simple function that updates a database. This was very little help. Sorry.
results.content_html: Section 6 where the main piece should be is very rough. This should be concentrating on the final project and showing examples of MVC the whole way on the same MVC files. Very confusing with moving bits of code between the view and controller without any touch on logic with model data in a separate file. After several lessons dealing with the dummy data, this should include how to import from a database. Suggest redoing this course for a simple register user, login user, and have user do simple function that updates a database. This was very little help. Sorry.

Hey Zubair,

Thank you for the review, I worked on UI5 Library building itself in Labs and Git.
And this is one of the best course available on the internet for UI5.

Please go for the refund if you are stuck, we provide it even if Udemy 30 days policy is over!


-Regards
Ajay

results.content: I have not finished this course yet but I am really disappointed (I have done 14 lectures so far ) , I wanted to learn sap UI5 and expected the lecturer to start explaining everything from scratch including java script , He is just writing code without explaining it and why it is written the way it is ( not explaining syntax ), I feel that he expects that you already know everything and you are just here to know where to place your code and how the flow of a UI5 code works .

results.content:
I am going to rate this course only 4 starts, I would have rated it 5 stars if it covered navigation and routing topic and also how to create custom components with jscript (and not XML).

Other than that from my point of view I think that it's one of the best presented courses on SAPui5 so far that I took part of,  but  the only thing that it lacks  is the 2 topics that I mentioned above.

I hope the instructors will add them in the near future.
results.content_html:
I am going to rate this course only 4 starts, I would have rated it 5 stars if it covered navigation and routing topic and also how to create custom components with jscript (and not XML).

Other than that from my point of view I think that it's one of the best presented courses on SAPui5 so far that I took part of, but the only thing that it lacks is the 2 topics that I mentioned above.

I hope the instructors will add them in the near future.

Very good course! I really recommend it!
But you need some JavaScript background to make thing's easier.
I learned several bases of SAPUI5 with this course.
Helped me a lot to understand between the basic and intermediate.
I know the focus of the course was not to expose the SAP part, but the Gateway bonus topic could show a bit more of the configuration in SAP.
Best regards.

results.content: Amazing course! Great pace and examples. It keeps you involved and awake. Not boring at all. All information is given in a very detailed and understandable manner. Thank you for creating and publishing it.
results.content_html: Amazing course! Great pace and examples. It keeps you involved and awake. Not boring at all. All information is given in a very detailed and understandable manner. Thank you for creating and publishing it.

results.content:
Details are great, lectures are organized and informative, it was shown how to use the documentation to write views in .js. I have learned a lot from this course. Documentation about how to write js views in sapui5 are scarce, so I really appreciate having this course. 

However, the following was kind of missing, which would be great to add to the course to make it more comprehensive:
- I need to see how c9 was configured to run sapui5; this is just missing or assumed easy, which was not easy for me as I have never used aws before.
- A lecture addressing consuming HTTPS requests/services is missing. The assignment at the end includes consuming services whereas we did not cover that during the lectures. I wish we had that before the assignment to be able to do the assignment by myself.
results.content_html:
Details are great, lectures are organized and informative, it was shown how to use the documentation to write views in .js. I have learned a lot from this course. Documentation about how to write js views in sapui5 are scarce, so I really appreciate having this course.

However, the following was kind of missing, which would be great to add to the course to make it more comprehensive:
- I need to see how c9 was configured to run sapui5; this is just missing or assumed easy, which was not easy for me as I have never used aws before.
- A lecture addressing consuming HTTPS requests/services is missing. The assignment at the end includes consuming services whereas we did not cover that during the lectures. I wish we had that before the assignment to be able to do the assignment by myself.

results.content:
Great course for anyone who is slightly aware of SAPUI5. This course covers a lot of interesting concepts in UI5. But I wish the tutorials used xml views. Also at certain points, some concepts were introduced with very little or no explanation. The last bonus section started abruptly and felt disconnected from the rest of the course.
But overall a really nice course for anyone who wishes to start with SAPUI5. Many thanks to the tutor; looking forward to learning other courses as well.
results.content_html:
Great course for anyone who is slightly aware of SAPUI5. This course covers a lot of interesting concepts in UI5. But I wish the tutorials used xml views. Also at certain points, some concepts were introduced with very little or no explanation. The last bonus section started abruptly and felt disconnected from the rest of the course.
But overall a really nice course for anyone who wishes to start with SAPUI5. Many thanks to the tutor; looking forward to learning other courses as well.

Tutorial is really good , i'm really enjoying it .

e.g - press:[oController.goToSecondPage,oController] the oController after , was not explained why it has been used how it can used . How to explore the below function : navButtonPress:function(oEvt){app.back() .  i know we can check it in UI5 EXPLORED but i wanted to know about app.back() and related functions we can use .

results.content: Excelente didática! Talvez devesse chamar mais a atenção sobre algumas sutilezas. isto é, quando são utilizados textos de código pronto. Podem existir sutis porém, fundamentais diferenças. É verdade que são muitas, mas um dos aspectos que me impressionaram bem, foi justamente essa preocupação com os detalhes de cada segmento de um projeto (index.html, views, controllers etc.). A preocupação com os princípios subjacentes (e.g. conceitos MVC), seria algo que eu não esperava.

results.content: I highly recommend this course if you want to learn UI5 from scratch. I have been working in SAP for 3 years and I did not have enough exposure in JavaScript, but this course helped me overcome my shortcomings and understand the basics of UI5. The instructor is direct-to-point and helps us understand the real world application of UI5 . He promptly explains the methods. This course has been a great experience for a UI5 fresher like me.

results.content:
Mindless typing without understanding.
The biggest problem is that you can't learn every component of UI5 in any course.
So, people need to learn how to utilize documentation.
But in this course, Instructor just type some code and run without explanation.

I can create almost all front-end functionalities of UI5 with pure html5, css3 and javascript,
But I can't with UI5 library. 
only with sap's documentation, It's almost impossible to structure code properly if you don't already know them.
results.content_html:

results.content:
This is only an overview of SAP UI5, the teaching method gives so much to wish for, the examples are poorly explained (it´s almost copy+paste). Additionally, the subtitles are blocking the code that the instructor writes and were created automatically by a software based on the instructor´s voice. In many cases the texts are wrong understood:
- SAP --> SFP
- UI5 --> you are fife
- MVC (model view controller) --> NBC (american football)
- many, many examples more

If you plan to start developing with SAP UI5, then you need to get more support (books, tutorials, on-site course, etc) because this training is not much of a help.
results.content_html:
This is only an overview of SAP UI5, the teaching method gives so much to wish for, the examples are poorly explained (it´s almost copy+paste). Additionally, the subtitles are blocking the code that the instructor writes and were created automatically by a software based on the instructor´s voice. In many cases the texts are wrong understood:
- SAP --> SFP
- UI5 --> you are fife
- MVC (model view controller) --> NBC (american football)
- many, many examples more

If you plan to start developing with SAP UI5, then you need to get more support (books, tutorials, on-site course, etc) because this training is not much of a help.

results.content:
Stuck and unable to move forward with the course. No responses to queries. 
Cloud development environment usage is tricky and requires credit card details to setup and still issues in the website doesnt allow you to create account. Instead of Cloud 9, why not use SAP Web IDE which is free to use. Also eclipse environment available now differs from what is shown in videos and there are plenty of issues firing it up to run sap ui5 code. 

Time wasted in completing 21% of the course.
